SeatGeek CX Event Expert
item.description: <p>Do you love helping people? Are you smart, humorous, and creative? Are communication and working under pressure two of your best skills? If you answered “yes” to all of the above, keep reading!</p><p>As a member of our Event Expert team, you’ll be the voice of SeatGeek. You’ll interact with customers through phone calls, emails, live chat and social media to resolve their issues and stay in the know about SeatGeek’s latest features. We are passionate about providing ridiculously good customer service, and our Event Expert folks are some of the best and brightest in the industry.</p><p>We are looking for Event Experts who can commit to shifts from 11-7pm or 12-8pm PST. We may require some weekend work as well. Currently we are looking to expand our team in the Portland, OR area.</p><h3>Who you are and what you have:</h3><p>You have a bachelor's degree.<br/>You are genuinely interesting, personable and intelligent. Current members of SeatGeek team include a former beekeeper, opera singer, gourmet hot dog vendor and an Olympic-hopeful fencer<br/>You love live events and understand that purchasing tickets to see your favorite band is not the same as buying a stapler. In other words, you can empathize with SeatGeek customers.<br/>Prior experience working in CX. A tech startup is a major plus.<br/>You aren’t intimidated by numbers and understand the value of using data to make intelligent decisions.<br/>You are a people person and are known to carry on a conversation with anyone.<br/>You are passionate about technology and user experience.</p><h3>What you’ll do:</h3><p>Be the first point of contact for customer questions through phone, email, live chat, and social media (even on the weekends!)<br/>Use metrics and consumer insight to help make SeatGeek better<br/>Consistently go above and beyond for our customers (think generous refunds and unexpected gifts, just because!)</p><h3>Perks</h3><p>Competitive salary in a well-funded early stage company<br/>$120/mo to spend on live events tickets<br/>A superb benefits package that supports health/dental/vision<br/>Spotify memberships and a discounted gym membership<br/>Three weeks of paid vacation per year</p>

item.title: Castle Account Manager
item.description: <p>Your mission will be to care for our owners, tenants, and properties—the core of Castle’s business.</p><p>Owners trust us with their properties. Tenants trust us to meet their needs. As an Account Manager, you will nurture the trust of both parties. Specific duties include customer onboarding, marketing properties, moving tenants in (and out), collecting rent, and fielding maintenance requests. You’ll also help supervise a team of Customer Service Representatives.</p><p>Since Castle is still so young, you should also expect to critically evaluate our processes and makes suggestions for improvement. We believe there is always room to improve, and we need your help making our processes the best they can be.</p><p>We have a remote-first culture, so we won't require you to move to Detroit. If you want to move here, or you already live here, you'll be working out of our headquarters.</p><h3>You should be:</h3><p>Detail- and process-oriented<br/>A top-flight verbal and written communicator<br/>Driven to make everything better<br/>A good cop at heart, but a bad cop if need be</p><h3>You’ll get:</h3><p>$40k/year<br/>0.1% equity</p><p>Interested? Tell us why you want to join the team at <a href="mailto:fillintheblank@entercastle.com"><a href="mailto:&#x66;&#105;&#108;l&#x69;&#x6e;t&#104;&#x65;&#x62;&#108;&#97;&#110;&#107;&#64;&#x65;&#x6e;&#116;&#101;&#114;&#99;&#x61;&#115;&#116;&#108;&#x65;&#46;&#99;&#x6f;&#109;">&#x66;&#105;&#108;l&#x69;&#x6e;t&#104;&#x65;&#x62;&#108;&#97;&#110;&#107;&#64;&#x65;&#x6e;&#116;&#101;&#114;&#99;&#x61;&#115;&#116;&#108;&#x65;&#46;&#99;&#x6f;&#109;</a></a>. Résumé not necessary.</p>

This is a 5 day per week position with shifts that may be from Mon-Sun and may include evening work.</p><p>This position is available immediately, so please apply ASAP!</p>
